description: Democracy is widely regarded as a triumph of liberal civilization. Yet democratic citizens are so
often ignorant, irrational, and narrow-minded. Meanwhile, a new wave of populists, elitists, and
autocrats are challenging democratic institutions and assumptions. This course explores the moral
justifications for democracy in light of
major objections and investigates whether there is something genuinely virtuous about the
kind of society it sustains. Students discuss sources in philosophy
